title: Postcard, "Restaurant Florent:  Mirth (typography/table)", 1989
creditline: Gift of Tibor Kalman/ M & co.
description:
Recto: The central image of this restaurant postcard, placed vertically, is a round grey table top, probably marble or plastic laminate, on a black x-shaped pedestal. In various typefaces, words related to the clientele (e.g. friend, loafers, pump [shoe] are positioned so as to represent the figure of a male customer on the left and a female on the right, while words signifying the menu (e.g. grilled salmon, wine), accouterments (e.g. fork, chair) and mood (e.g. mirth, glow) are positioned on or in proximity to the table. In the lower right hand corner on the diagonal, the name and address of the restaurant are imprinted on four lines in capital letters, with restaurant in larger and bolder type. 
Verso: With the card now turned horizontally, the name, address and other identifying information are imprinted on the upper left; post card and stamp are imprinted on the right in the addressee area.
